headers.subject: Re: Openssl-0.9.6d and Openssh-3.4 error (solved)
headers.received: (from mail@localhost) by int-mx1.corp.redhat.com (8.11.6/8.11.6) id g5T3bAZ14502 for redhat-list@listman.redhat.com; Fri, 28 Jun 2002 23:37:10 -0400
from [63.228.114.5] by web11507.mail.yahoo.com via HTTP; Fri, 28 Jun 2002 20:37:08 PDT
headers.list-id: General Red Hat Linux discussion list <redhat-list.redhat.com>

body.para: I appreciate your help. I just edited the /etc/ld.so.conf file and added /srv/ssl/lib and openssh configured just fine. --- David Talkington <dtalk@prairienet.org> wrote:

quote.quotepara: now when I try to install openssh I get that error.

And you're subsequently building openssh with --with-ssl-dir=/srv/ssl? That should work fine. If not, then ya got me, but I'll mention that I don't use the --openssldir option, and I do have the binaries in my path and the libs in my LD_LIBRARY_PATH at compile time.
-----BEGIN PGP SIGNATURE----- Version: PGP 6.5.8 Comment: Made with pgp4pine 1.75-6
